value.0: The curator at the Freeport museum, Eluril Cendal, told you that recently the Talisman of the Aribel has been stolen.  It's believed that a mad wizard Keptalos is behind it, but there is no evidence and no knowledge of his whereabouts.
A Heist in Freeport

High Lord Malbork has informed you of an ongoing political struggle with the Borkmals.  He tells you that you need to go into the sewers and the Theives Guild to find a document rumored to contain the true ruling family of the province.

Grand Duke Borkmal has informed you of an ongoing political struggle with the Malborks.  He tells you that you need to go into the sewers and the Theives Guild to find a document rumored to contain the true ruling family of the province.
You have told High Lord Malbork that he is the sole ruler of the province and of your intentions to dispatch the Borkmals.
You have told Archduke Borkmal that he is the sole ruler of the province and of your intentions to dispatch the Malborks.
Archduke Borkmal is dead, return to High Lord Malbork for your reward.
High Lord Malbork is dead, return to Archduke Borkmal for your reward.
Quest Complete.
A House Divided...

Comment.value:
I have accepted a task from the Guild House Master.
He wants me to remove a target. An unsavoury robber hiding somewhere in town, and retrieve the Brooch he stole.
This Task is to prove my ability for further Tasks.

I have eliminated my target and recovered the Brooch. Only now am I informed that he was a loose end.
The actual target is to be the owner of the Brooch, but the loose end had to be tied before an attempt could be made.
My next target is to be an Official's Wife, here in Freeport. I am told that her death will weaken the official's resolve in certain matters.

With the Officials Wife removed from the picture, The Guild House Master has deemed it necessary to make a daring attack at sea. I am to steal a boat and meet a merchant ship arriving at Freeport, carrying a passenger that the letter I used as proof of The Wife's demise, instigates his alliance to her cause.

The Passenger is no more. The Official's Wife's Lover, no doubt!
It seams that I could have saved alot of issues if I had my next target as my first target. The confusion of the Wife and Her Lover removed, the true brains behind the Official has been discovered. His Aid must die!
Only then will the Official be under the Guild House Master's control.

I have proved my worth and removed all targets that The Guild House Master charged me with.
The Freeport Official is now being Blackmailed with the murder of his Wife and her Lover.
Another Official under the Control of The Guild.
The Guild House Master has implied that there could be other House Masters to find.
Assassin Tasks

Ranger Garen Aset tells you that a group of bandits have taken over much of the Aleutian mountain range making it nearly impossible to reach the river.  Their hideout is believed to be somewhere in the Central Plateau.  If you're able to bring back proof of the Bandit Leaders demise, he says you'll be amply rewarded.
Quest Completed
Bandits
St.  Nick told you that if you bring a Water Bowl & a Ring of Ice to him he can craft you a Ring of Christmas.
Quest Completed.
Christmas In Blackwell (2010)

You have met with the drow slave captain, he informed you that if you are able to kill the Drow Slaver in the Warriors Academy and take his key to Ardureil in the slave pens.  Tho he set no particular reward, it's possible that his people might be able to fight along side you.
The Drow Slaver's Key has been given to Ardureil, the rebel leader.  He gave you a note to deliver to Queen Desend.
Elrith Desend, Queen of Elves has told you of a slave rebellion among the drow.  You must go there and help free her people.
You delivered the note to Queen Desend.  She seemed momentarily relieved, but you know the story does not end here.
Enslaved Elves
Welcome to The Awakening
Getting Started
Gribigorn has give you a letter.  He says if you deliver it to his brother he might be able to upgrade your armor.

You have delivered Gribigorn's letter.  Brigron would be willing to upgrade your armor, but some one has stolen his anvil.  It's rumored to be in the possession of the Duergar, but no one knows for sure...
You've returned Brigron's Anvil.  He is now willing to upgrade your armor.  You need a mithril ore, Fafnir's Armor, and 30 million gold pieces.
Gribigorn's Letter

Legendary Levels
Higher Ground Legendary Levels are a mechanism by which your character continues to increase in power after level 40. They are NOT normal levels, and they only affect some of your character's attributes. They do not, for instance, affect caster level, spell penetration, or attack bonus. The ONLY affects that they have are listed below. The class in which you can levels is your "control class", which is basically whatever class you have the most levels in at 40th. Once you take Legendary Levels you will no longer be able to relevel, nor is it likely that DMs will be able to help you fix any mistakes.
---------
Skills:
Characters gain their normal allotment of skill points for every legendary level, including a +1 bonus for humans and any intelligence bonuses. They spend them in the usual manner, with class skills costing one point and cross-class skills costing 2 points. Points may be saved from level to level, if desired.

Feats:
Characters continue to gain a general feat every three levels, beginning at level 42, 3 levels after the last received at level 39. Some classes gain access to feats they might not otherwise have in Legendary Levels, check class customizations for specifics.

Ability Points:
Characters gain ability points at an accelerated rate during legendary levels, receiving an additional ability point every 2 levels, beginning at level 42.

Saving Throws:
Character saving throws increase during legendary levels, but at a slower pace than before. A character gains +1 to all saving throws every 4 levels, beginning at level 44.

Hit Points:
Characters automatically gain the maximum hitpoints for their class, including a bonus for the toughness feat and any constitution bonuses.

Current XP Requirements:
40 = 780000
41 = 1000000
42 = 1200000
43 = 1400000
44 = 1600000
45 = 1800000
46 = 2000000
47 = 2200000
48 = 2400000
49 = 2600000
50 = 2800000
51 = 3000000
52 = 3200000
53 = 3400000
54 = 3600000
55 = 3800000
56 = 4000000
57 = 4200000
58 = 4400000
59 = 4600000
60 = 4800000

(Taken from NWVault posting, original author: FunkySwerve)
Info: Legendary Levels
Saunder's Farmhand tells you that there's been a bit of trouble with out of control chickens.
Quest Completed
Rabid Chickens

Deelia Weeber mentioned they've been having a terrible time with rats in the basement of the Wanderer's Inn.  If you're able to get rid of the dire rat that's taken residence there, she'd be thankful.
Quest Completed
Rats in the Inn

I have accepted a Task from the Guild House Master.
I have been charged with the acquisition of a Gem, which I am to retrieve from the House's vault. Obviously a test of my prowess.

I have accepted a Task from the Guild House Master.
I have been charged with the acquisition of a Gem, which I am to retrieve from the House's vault. Obviously a test of my prowess.

I have proven myself of worthy skill value to The Guild House Master.
He wants me to steal some documents from an Official called Dufrat Le'Muire, here in Freeport.

He wants me to steal some documents from an Official called Dufrat Le'Muire, here in Freeport. 

I have retrieved the documents from The Official but they instigate another to be the brains behind the problem.
I have now been charged to steal his Aid's Ring, an official wax letter seal.

I have now been charged to steal his Aid's Ring, an official wax letter seal.

With the Aid's Ring handed over to The Guild House Master, I have been charged with a final Task. I must steal The Chain of Office from Dufrat Le'Muire, the Freeport Official.

I have now been charged to steal his Aid's Ring, an official wax letter seal.

With the Aid's Ring handed over to The Guild House Master, I have been charged with a final Task. I must steal The Chain of Office from Dufrat Le'Muire, the Freeport Official.

That's it, all my Task's here are complete.
My acquisitions have been coincided with other events and the Official is now Under The Guild House Master's control.
The Guild House Master has implied that there could be other House Masters to find.
Rogue Tasks
The Saunders', who live on the outskirts of Providence, told you their son Jonah has gone missing in the bewilderness.
You've managed to save the clutches of the witch Ajouga.  You think it might be wise to make sure he's made it safely home.
Quest Completed
Saving Jonah Saunders

Welcome to The Awakening CEP2.3!  Thank you for playing.  If you have an feedback or suggestions; or want to see more in detail what the customizations are here see our forum theawakening1.freeforums.org

We're still in the process of testing and tweaking areas and integrating new ones, so things may change from one reset to another.  Patience and suggestions are appreciated. D

Useful Info
1. You must be 18th level or above to use +4 items and 28th or above to use +5.
2. Invest in the Parry skill!  It grants 1% immunity to critical hits per point.  (Bonuses from gear count.)  You will definitely need this for sure in the higher levels.
3. Get at least 1 point of open lock.

If you have any questions or need any help, don't hestitate to ask!

Thanks for playing!
pope_leo  Matt20x  --Saavedra--
Server Information
The Grand Elementalist has informed you that the Elemental Lords seek ?????????????????????.  If you succeed you will be rewarded with a ring of greater power to combat the elements.
Quest Completed.
The Elemental Lords

You have met with a member of the Thieves Guild.  Though somewhat circumspect, she told you that if you were able to complete a few jobs for her.  You might prove your worth and be allowed in the inner circle.  Your first job: Rob the Bank of Borkmal.
You've robbed the bank of Borkmal and went back for your second job: An elder woman in Malbork possess a diamond of great worth.  Get the diamond and bring it back.
You got the diamond.  Now, she asked you to go to the Freeport Museum.  The only clue as to which painting the buyer wants is "there is no painting greater than a sharply observed portrait."
Job four: After all parting...  You need to find a wedding ring.  God knows where it is...
Job Five: Fix the Blackwell Elections.  Go and switch the ballots.

You have completed all the jobs, but were informed that you will not be accepted in the inner circle.  Appearantly you've been played for a fool.  You will have to find some other way to get passed security.
You have the key to enter the Inner Circle.  Now, you'll need to fight your way through and find the document for Malbork and Borkmal.
The Inner Circle

Fallbeard the Elder has told you of the mad sorcerer Azuraz, he seeks to take the power of the Tree of Life.  You must find him, free Ashfrond, and stop him before he is able to find and enter the Ancient Copse.  The promised reward is limited access to the Tree.
You have killed Azurax, freed Ashfrond and proved your worth to the Treants.  You are now able to use the Branch of the Tree of Life.  Speak to Fallbeard the Elder in the Ancient Copse for details.
You now have access to the Tree of Life.  Speak to Fallbeard the Elder to charge or recharge the Branch from the Tree of Life.
The Tree of Life

Master Zhòng Shóu is upset about a recent string of unusual events, especially the desecration of the founder to their order's grave. Despite his troubles he has given me a token of kindness and invited me to rest in the temple.

A clearly, troubled monk has confided in me that some of his brothers are not what they seem. He has given me a key and requested that I investigate a secret passage that he has located in the basement of the temple.
I have recovered the skull of Xie Zhongxiang, the temples founder. Master Zhòng Shóu would surely be grateful to have this safely returned.

So the Evil Monks of The White Crane Temple have been thwarted. Master Zhòng Shóu was extremely grateful for my aid in the matter, so grateful he gave me some Robes for my effort. I'm sure he will have the Temple up and running to full capacity, now that members of the order won't be vanishing. I can't help but wonder though, who are The Dark Order and what were their motives behind summoning Volran?
Troubled Monks
